snippet: The purchasing managers' index indicated a slight expansion in business activity in China's vast factory sector, but the reading was barely above 50, which demarcates expansion from contraction.
abstract: China's purchasing managers' index rises to 50.3 points in December from 49 in November; reading of 50 separates expansion from contraction; analysts say downward risks persist and suggest economy will need fresh policy support to counter a slowdown in growth.
lead_paragraph: The purchasing managers' index indicated a slight expansion in business activity in China's vast factory sector, but the reading was barely above 50, which demarcates expansion from contraction.

headline.main: Manufacturing in China Grew Only Slightly in December
headline.print_headline: Some New Data From Asia Shows Continued Slowdown
